headline: Square Parent Block Jumps On S&P 500 News; Robinhood Snubbed Yet Again
summary: Square-parent Block will join the S&P 500 before Wednesday's open. Block stock jumped. Robinhood and AppLovin were snubbed yet again.

raw.headline: Square Parent Block Jumps On S&P 500 News; Robinhood Snubbed Yet Again

headline: Block to Replace Hess in S&P 500 Index. Shares Jump on Admission News.
summary: The financial technology company will join the index before the start of trading on Wednesday, according to S&P Dow Jones Indices.

raw.headline: Block to Replace Hess in S&P 500 Index. Shares Jump on Admission News.
raw.summary: The financial technology company will join the index before the start of trading on Wednesday, according to S&P Dow Jones Indices.

headline: Robinhood, AppLovin Could Soon Join S&P 500 as Hess Deal Creates Opening in Index
summary: Robinhood  Markets or  AppLovin  could gain admission to the S&P 500 now that an opening has been created with Chevron’s acquisition of Hess Friday.  There has been ongoing speculation that  Robinhood  and  AppLovin  could join the  because they are the largest U.S. companies based on market capitalization that aren’t now in the benchmark index.  AppLovin is valued at $123 billion and Robinhood at $93 billion.

headline: Jim Cramer Says AppLovin Has “No Real Competition”
summary: AppLovin Corporation (NASDAQ:APP) is one of the stocks on Jim Cramer’s radar. During the episode, Cramer noted that the company has “no real competition.” He commented: “AppLovin is a hugely profitable way for companies to advertise through mobile video games, which are typically free as long as you watch the ads.
